job_title: Senior Care Assistant in Poole, England
pros: Overall it's a good place to work if you enjoy working in care. I've had a very good work-relation with the management and the carers. If you focus on your work and you are a reliable worker they will help you with the NVQs and you can have many opportunities to progress within the company.
cons: No cons, maybe better pay rate

job_title: Home Care Assistant in Taunton, England
pros: Working on bank- great work life balance
cons: unorganised at times with shift planning, locations of clients.

pros: Great team . Excellent HR support.
cons: Recent home management has become extremely disappointing. Losing some good staff either leaving or transferring due to a  passive aggressive type control of the home. no sign of the staff monthly treat allowance . Which was always provided with a smile.and appreciated. I enjoy my job sadly the shine has some what dulled. (More annual leave would be a bonus.

pros: Shift patterns suitable for work life balance
cons: Total lack of care, support and respect provided to staff from senior staff

pros: Some staff members, you know where NOT to put a loved one
cons: Disorganised, procedures not followed, a lot of rooms in disrepair, rarely the right equipment for residents- always looking for or borrowing slings! Witnessed inappropriate and dangerous moving and handling. Staff not looked after or respected.

pros: Lovely residents rewarding helping them.
cons: Poor treatment of staff and not enough staff for residents

pros: I struggle to think of any
cons: I have never worked in such a toxic environment before and I would never wish to again. Senior management seem more focused on making a surplus than they do about anything else. People are treated as commodities not human beings. The fact that they feel they are genuinely caring would be funny if it wasn't so disgusting.

job_title: Careworkers in Weymouth, Dorset, South West England, England
pros: None that I can find
cons: Often leave new members of staff to care for around 30 residents alone while the rest go on cigarette breaks, Starbucks. They fill out daily tasks stating all residents were fed at 8.30 am when in fact many come looking for breakfast at 11.Agency workers leave residents soaked in urine up to their necks for daytime staff to deal with.

review_title: If you are considering working for Care south DONT.
job_title: Human Resources Partner in Poole, England
pros: There isn’t anything good about this company.
cons: The senior management team are toxic

job_title: Housekeeper in Dorchester, South West England, England
pros: Love the residents and housekeeping team
cons:
Under payed
Under staffed
No support from the management they just hide in the offices
If you choose to try and further your career unless you are a carer their is no support from the management.
Money wasted on making the home look pretty but not on improving the residents lives

pros: Lovely residents and nice staff
cons: Loved my job . But left after nearly 33 years with the company. Due to no real help and support when I was going through severe anxiety. Found out this company doesn't really value their staff . At the end of the day we are all just no . After my length of service . Not even a letter and card to say Thank you !!

pros: Staff service recognition, professional development
cons: Uncompetitive salary, not always valued

review_title: A company whose aim is to improve people’s lives
job_title: Human Resources Business Partner in Poole, England
pros: Feel you’re part of an organisation trying to make a difference to people’s lives
cons: No major cons to the role

job_title: Care At Home Assistant in Bournemouth, England
pros: Lovely team of truly caring people
cons: Long hours, weekends, hard work

pros: Most of the team has been really hard working.
cons: It is really hard work. There is constant request to do more and more. If you are not happy to do overtime you would be punished. Also thers is a constant lack of people, so how can you provide a good care level to the residents ? Really sad.

job_title: Deputy Home Manager in Poole, England
pros: Good rates of pay good ethics
cons: None really worked for them before and returned so can’t be bad

pros: Lovely Residents. Staff great but unfortunately leaving.
cons:
You will wait 2 months for your first pay, as they pay a month in arrears which they do not tell you at interview. Your pay will never be correct and you will always be chasing your salary and sorting out your finances accordingly. Management are clueless, staff overworked due to staff leaving and nobody wanting to work for this company. .If you want to feel overworked and not appreciated and be constantly messed about in 2019 then this is the place for you.

You will be better off unemployed than working for Care South!

review_title: Loved my job with this company
job_title: Out of Hours Administrator in Weymouth, Dorset, South West England, England
pros: I loved working for care south . I miss the job terribly
cons: Being made redundant . Broke my heart as I loved my boss , the managers , the clients . Have never found such a lovely job in all the years since I left

review_title: The high staff turnover speaks for itself.
pros: The people I get to work with directly.
cons: The terrible salary structure, the poor management, dreadful attitude of upper (head office) management to the care staff..

job_title: Care Assistant in Weymouth, Dorset, South West England, England
pros: Lovely residents, good co-workers (when they stay!)
cons: Management has favorites, if your face fits you can get away with anything.  Other staff are either ignored or bullied.  Very high staff turnover.  Management has no interest in their employee's well being.

pros: Working with residents and staff
cons:
Unfair treatment of staff. weekend enhancements taken away from residential staff,despite verbal agreements at interview.Home care staff still get enhancements. 
Do you value home carers more than residential staff?

pros:
This home has a long term problem with Bullying and unprofessional behaviour .
The carers are hardworking and kind . But they are unsupported and let down by Management ignore and encouragement bullying from Senior carers / Care Team leaders . One Care Team leader inparticular makes fun and impressionates certain residents and staff.
cons:
Lovely carers 
 Nice grounds

pros: Great friends made with care assistant colleagues
cons:
Will under pay you and refuse to give you the money.
Know nothing about employment law

pros: Good training, beautiful homes. Lovely residents
cons: Not enough staff, rude and pushy

pros: You get to help wonderful residents.
cons: Disgusting management, many safeguarding issues. I would never put any family member in this home.
